fsFields.helpText:
YOU MUST fill this out with sufficient detail.  See below: 
 Examples of NOT ENOUGH DETAIL:  ‘ Import and export of business products’ or ‘ Healthcare Products’ or ‘Real Estate’ 
Examples of ENOUGH DETAIL:  ‘Import and Export of children’s toys where, import to China and Taiwan, export to Southeast Asia or ‘Retails Sale of healthcare products such as equipment for measuring blood pressure and blood sugar, vitamins, etc.  Mr. A and his brother are the owners of the company with Mr. A being the decision maker in the company’ 
For clients with an Account Plan or BCA, the RM can use the same text to describe the business that is used in the Account Plan and/or BCA 
The description MUST BE CONSISTENT with the ISIC code selected.

fsFields.name: in_nature_of_biz

fsFields.helpText: Demonstrate understanding of the origin of funds to be used / received throughout the relationship. In practice that means the activity from which the funds are ultimately derived (e.g., the customer’s business activities or sale of assets). \nDescription such as 'Business proceeds' would be fine if there is information available, for example, financial statements demonstrating a business that generates such proceeds. If there is a BCA for the customer, RM should have such data on its ability to generate revenues. For non-borrowing customers with no BCA, more description is required, for example, 'proceeds from media business that generates $x of annual sales and has a record operating income of $y in 2011.
fsFields.label: Source of Funds
fsFields.name: in_funds_source

fsFields.helpText:
Document in detail the customer’s business activities, going beyond the description for (A). The RM should cover some of the following: 
(i) Describe the main business Divisions / Lines of Business of the customer where applicable 
(ii) Describe the main product lines of the business Divisions 
(iii) Describe any major clients of the customer 
(iv) Describe any major suppliers to the customer 
(v) Describe any competitors of the customer 
(vi) Describe the main countries or regions where the customer does business 
Where the RM has completed an Account Plan or BCA either at the entity level or at the level of the customer’s group, the RM may cross reference any detailed information included in those documents and limit the description in eCDD+ to a short summary of the above. There is no need to attach the Account Plan or BCA provided that the Account Plan or BCA can be retrieved on request by a reviewer (e.g., Compliance, Audit, regulator).
fsFields.label: Detailed description of business activities
fsFields.name: in_biz_act_desc

fsFields.helpText: Where the Trust / Foundation is supporting significant activities, describes those activities in detail and the locations in which the Trust / Foundation is active.
fsFields.label: Detailed description of business activities that the trust / foundation supports
fsFields.name: in_desc_act_trust

fsFields.helpText: The RM should:\n- Identify and record names of any large contributors / donors to the NGO or charity \n- Record the geographic locations served (including headquarters and operational areas)
fsFields.label: Detailed description of the activities of the NGO or charity
fsFields.name: in_desc_act_NGO

fsFields.helpText: For example:\n-Professional society for lawyers or accountants: the members’ objective is to maintain their professional qualification status.\n -Recreational club: the members are entitled to the usage of the recreational facilities, (e.g., golf course etc.) available in the country as well as overseas where the club operates. Where the club operates in different countries, record all the geographic locations.
fsFields.label: Describe how members or associates use or benefit from the club / society
fsFields.name: in_club_mem_benefit_desc

fsFields.label: Is the entity an off-shore trusts?
fsFields.name: in_offshore_trusts

fsFields.helpText:
Unduly Complex Structure 
‘Complex structure’ of ownership generally means there are 4 layers or more of shareholding ownership between the company and the ultimate principal beneficial owners. ‘Unduly complex structure’ means that a complex structure has been put in place for no apparent purpose, suggesting that it is mainly there to disguise the beneficial owners. 
 The following types of entities are not considered ‘unduly complex structure’:
(i) Entities with any of their principal shareholders being publicly quoted company on a regulated market listed in Appendix G or its majority owned subsidiary; or 
 (ii) Entities with any of their principal shareholders being a financial institution regulated by an equivalent regulator or its majority owned subsidiary (excluding a money service bureau); or 
 (iii) Entities with any of their principal shareholders being a government or government entity or its majority owned subsidiary from a low or medium risk country; or 
(iv) Entities with any of their principal shareholders being a significant and well-established entity or its majority owned subsidiary.
 NB: Principal shareholder means owns a proportionate aggregate interest of at least 25% shares/ capital or voting rights.
fsFields.label: Does the entity have an unduly complex structure of ownership?
fsFields.name: in_unduly_complex_ownship

fsFields.helpText: Answer this question as ‘Yes’ for all discretionary accounts of an IMAA Regulated or Registered in a Non Equivalent Jurisdiction

errors.message: 'Does the Client Have a Guarantor' is required
'What is the purpose and reason for opening the account?' is required
'Does the entity issue bearer shares?' is required
'Does the customer  conduct business with any countries subject to the controls in the SCB Group Sanctions Policy and Procedures?' is required
'Is the entity involved in the Gaming/Casino business?' is required
'Does the entity trade in rough diamonds?' is required
'Is this client a Personal Investment Company (PIC)?' is required
'Is there any Adverse Media news on the client and / or its related entities? ' is required
There is no FATCA status selected for this client. The case cannot be submitted without a FATCA status.
